es.usal.bicoverlapper.utils
Class CustomColor

java.lang.Object
  es.usal.bicoverlapper.utils.CustomColor

public class CustomColor
extends java.lang.Object

Customized Color class with transparency properties. TODO: to be converted in java.awt.Color extension

Author:
Roberto Theron and Rodrigo Santamaría

Constructor Detail

CustomColor

public CustomColor()
Default constructor: black, transparent

CustomColor

public CustomColor(int red,
                   int green,
                   int blue,
                   int alpha)
Initializes to the specified color in RGB coordinates

Parameters:
red - - Red coordinate (scale from 0 to 255, 256 mean 0 again)
blue - - Blue coordinate (scale from 0 to 255, 256 mean 0 again)
green - - Green coordinate (scale from 0 to 255, 256 mean 0 again)
alpha - - Degree of transparency (0 means invisible, 255 solid)

CustomColor

public CustomColor(java.awt.Color c)
Builds a CustomColor from the color components of java.awt.Color

Parameters:
c - java.awtColor from which we take the color components

getA

public int getA()
Returns the alpha (transparency) component

Returns:
A number from 0 (transparent) to 255 (opaque)

setA

public void setA(int alpha)
Setter for the degree of transparency

Parameters:
alpha - Degree of transparency from 0 (invisible) to 255 (solid)

getOppositeColorToList

public CustomColor getOppositeColorToList(java.util.ArrayList used)
Returns the opposite color to an ArrayList of Colors. All Color coordinates in the array are added, and then the opposite is built. Transparency is not considered.

Parameters:
used - ArrayList with colors to add and get its opposite color
Returns:
the opposite color to a list of colors

addColor

public void addColor(CustomColor c)
Adds the color RGB coordinates of Color c to this Color. If resulting coordinates exceed 255 we restart at 0. Transparency is not added.

Parameters:
c - - Color to be added

getOppositeColor

public CustomColor getOppositeColor(CustomColor c)
Gets the opposite solid color to color c (transparency not considered)

Parameters:
c - Color to obtain the opposite
Returns:
The opposite color

getGoodColor

public static java.awt.Color getGoodColor(int n)
Returns a color with one of the color identifiers defined

Parameters:
n - Identifier of the color to obtain
Returns:
the corresponding color

getGoodCustomColor

public static CustomColor getGoodCustomColor(int n)
Returns a color with one of the color identifiers defined

Parameters:
n - Identifier of the color to obtain
Returns:
the corresponding color
